B4E38E365A6C4F76BA6A00C9A50889FE.description: Use general academic and domain specific words and phrases accurately.

2CA52A201005417EA7B1048EAC17841A.description: Use grade appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases accurately within writing.

ED8D1611D35D4F34B4393F5B9CE1DEAF.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when
considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

0C8C188C4D2E4FA78713F843C7886AC3.description: Interpret the use of personification within a text.

6B6765ED57BE4D489A0E2EEA0997F6EA.description: Interpret personification to help explain the characters within a text.

FCC1E34DD8B145D0812DDCA62FBC991E.description: Identify the connotative meaning (the idea associated with the word) of a word or phrase.

EF376CC7BF634209A1105996721C8C58.description:
Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category) to better understand each of the
words.

2A71FFF7EB4A4049B384BE223372AC25.description:
Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) in writing to promote understanding
of each of the words.

BE29F76E9EE7418A88DA5BE5F8A057D9.description: Use figurative language appropriately, including similes and metaphors.

2C6FBAE409434E718E0C7402FEA198AB.description: Explain the meaning of figures of speech (e.g., personification, idioms, proverbs) in context.

77ED11870FA64541BF4CE1352A908FD0.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
a. Interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification) in context.
b. Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category) to better understand each of the words.
c. Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical,
unwasteful, thrifty).

98808AF45C6B497C8BCA2F54C9AC14BB.description: Verify the prediction of the meaning of a new word or phrase (e.g., by checking a dictionary).

C5DD4C76174C4C6E996337154CA4AB8F.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the precise meaning of a word.

3FB27B3D73ED44979087893D43D651CE.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the synonym for a word.

BF94BB10B10B44D5BE5A79D7EC184D23.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the pronunciation of a word.

C7B8A9735EC546338F7C6217EE215A2E.description: Use common grade-appropriate roots and affixes as clues to the meaning of a word.

DFDAECF8F46E4D3187C8EEE9EBF56D0E.description: Use context to determine the meaning of unknown or multiple meaning words.

54930D7F3AF44A1C9EC9681CC90F004C.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing
flexibly from a range of strategies.
a. Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).
b. Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a
word or phrase.
c. Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or
determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.
d. Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase.

8A9C1C7449DE4E99B282E9C7C5AF9522.description: Vary sentence patterns for meaning, reader interest, and style within writing.

E92328FD751B4E5F9EA4BAED3FCDD1FB.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.
a. Vary sentence patterns for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.
b. Maintain consistent style and tone.

5F04567F4F0A4C2DAD65B6F73CDB02A3.description: Use commas, parentheses, and/or dashes in writing to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.

4B2646D058EC426EA26C06609E8EE258.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
a. Use punctuation (commas, parentheses, dashes) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.
b. Use correct spelling.

2B27D822D0C0403ABAE593503289FA29.description:
Use strategies (e.g., clarify language and grammar, vary sentence patterns, maintain consistent tone and style) to improve
written expression in conventional language.

4E9138F99B5844DDAA2B180F51EA89E0.description: Identify and use pronouns in accurately writing.

BF049C132FA54EB9B1824ADC791869BB.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or
speaking.
a. Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (subjective, objective, and possessive).
b. Use intensive pronouns (e.g., myself, ourselves).
c. Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person.
d. Recognize and correct vague pronouns (i.e., ones with unclear or ambiguous antecedents).
e. Recognize variations from Standard English in their own and others’ writing and speaking, and identify and use strategies to improve
expression in conventional language.

2A4FC12B15964E919D99A1CEBE8984BB.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

8CAAFB68688E4CF6A8150192858145CE.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate. (See grade 6
Language standards 1 and 3 for specific expectations.)

ED8DAE823F714E2D9332C114A8D6E443.description:
Use captioned pictures, labeled diagrams, tables, or other visual displays in presentations when appropriate to support the
topic or theme.

19F27ED29FB3492788BBB503B57FA976.description:
Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, images, music, sound) and visual displays in presentations to clarify
information.

F340D9EE3D6C4557882A27DB9569B808.description:
Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, images, music, and sound) and visual displays in
presentations to clarify information.

CB0D12A80FE5401DBECC42778B4CB61E.description: Report on a topic, story or claim with a logical sequence of ideas, appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details.

7AC752FC79334FB1BE7FF6123F22ADE9.description:
Present claims and findings, sequencing ideas logically and using pertinent descriptions, facts, and details to accentuate main ideas or themes;
use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

6109B0445BFC4C5EBF9D26D29AD0E435.description: Distinguish claims presented orally or in writing that are supported by reasons and claims that are not.

A7F9E7B27D544D768C8E76CED833740B.description: Distinguish claims or arguments from those that are supported by evidence from those that are not.

2EFCE8CA77E348CA9FC75DE0872A3404.description: Summarize the points an author makes.

5B6A3EB6E8464604AF0AF679FB7097D1.description: Summarize the points a speaker makes.

AEBAE75336E3497D8DB5A453F3BA6939.description: Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not

46CFC22B52B9472C8943B484F6F3D5B0.description: Explain how information gained via media and formats contributes to the understanding of a topic, text, or issue under study.

4B8F9C4C9CCC4ACE8F00005FD86ED008.description: Interpret information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally).

47047E7CD5EE45FB8FE5718859ED9531.description:
Interpret information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, and orally) and explain how it contributes to a
topic, text, or issue under study.

734214CB9E5742DE9DCF9070692C8C0F.description: Use information and feedback to refine own thinking.

4A5425D6EC624C89A3F91C0FC3FF7CB4.description: Use information and feedback to refine understanding or products.

5710215FAD264FBBAA9AF75C2103FB94.description: Review the key ideas expressed within a collaborative discussion linking multiple perspectives together.

CB7E645F67E34079856F3092E1C6DA32.description: Make appropriate comments that contribute to a collaborative discussion.

9824714632754C109061F49883C88B3E.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 6 topics,
texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.
a. Come to discussions prepared having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the
topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.
b. Follow rules for collegial discussions, set specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.
c. Pose and respond to specific questions with elaboration and detail by making comments that
contribute to the topic, text, or issue under discussion.
d. Review the key ideas expressed, draw conclusions, and demonstrate understanding of multiple perspectives through reflection and
paraphrasing.

CEFC2DC8D8DA4238AE4BFBE98B1F2B98.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

1CCB4976A3AE4948A5FD7A839EE24E97.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time
frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

960FC2700CDF44649C6DB6B1F43EEC14.description:
Analyze mentor texts to support knowledge of persuasive writing (e.g., analyze newspaper editorials to explore the way the
author developed the argument).

74F309297B88494A8F13DC83E3042AB2.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
a. Apply grade 6 Reading standards to literature.
b. Apply grade 6 Reading standards to informational text and nonfiction.

B95D7C9F743F4A5AAD2166B96EA454C7.description: Provide a bibliography for sources that contributed to the content within a writing piece.

B62720B7842741899C3D81155E0463AB.description: Provide a bibliography for sources that contributed to the content within a writing piece.

12E7A45869F14A1F94BA69CFA418D461.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others in writing while avoiding plagiarism.

71845E4900DD49B9AE2E8BEE15C6AC84.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others in writing while avoiding plagiarism.

CB9E2E73A5A94C7CA6345D9B2F9253E7.description: Gather information (e.g., highlight, quote or paraphrase from source) relevant to the topic from print and/or digital sources.

952F45141ED548ED886FD1918F6E5308.description:
Gather relevant information (e.g., highlight in text, quote or paraphrase from text or discussion) from print and/or digital
sources.

DAF8C9C071B84E6FB7E0756008944D76.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources; assess the credibility of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data
and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and providing basic bibliographic information for sources.

D5F2349B290C463F99F3458B481A8A1A.description:
Follow steps to complete a short research project (e.g., determining topic, locating information on a topic, organizing
information related to the topic, drafting a permanent product).

2ACDAC2F355D4BE2A02A5F138C51617B.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and refocusing the inquiry when appropriate.

C87A96431B1346F8B0389D7EF693F443.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

6B3D03D507D14637907F2579F1C3787D.description:
Use technology to produce and publish writing. (e.g., use internet to gather information; use word processing to generate and
collaborate on writing).

07ED51A647FC48A0AE1CFFA04EDDE4C8.description:
Use technology, including the internet, to type and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient
command of keyboarding skills to complete a writing task in a single sitting.

7BA7D7C776EA48AEAD73A009DD1A54BB.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing as needed by revising and editing.

2D8B307365BF4BE9B997A79BC151E0E6.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising and editing (e.g., review product,
strengthening story).

A68028E2E23C4FE6A485D4F5BEFCC4F4.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising and editing.

9874C764A1E14B909FE84B5CCCBA075B.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., determine the topic, gather information,
develop the topic, provide a meaningful conclusion).

893283FC13914146A8AC05DFED18A337.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., choose a topic, introduce story elements,
develop storyline, conclude story).

16DF562758834D8CA5AA83706F3C6DF9.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., define purpose, which is to persuade, state
your claim, gather evidence, create your argument, provide a meaningful conclusion).

7D9269DE0E604EC09FF94F3E20B837C9.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or
trying a new approach. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grade 6.)

994CC85B827F4118B8830C1B442C43AC.description:
Produce a clear, coherent, permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task purpose (e.g., to persuade), and
audience.

DA0FD64A5C2A4641A58E1B3D2D45B892.description:
Produce a clear, coherent, permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose (e.g. to entertain), and
audience.

3DB296BBF77641599D6700D19C455E57.description:
Produce a clear, coherent, permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task (e.g., topic), purpose (e.g., to inform), and
audience (e.g., reader).

58CD944BE8FB4D439F88DAA7AAA3F326.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Gradespecific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

A2457F139F7F4C17BBB6CC62C44B0599.description: Use figurative language appropriately, including similes and metaphors.

DED6315CAA644F38B4ADA96B2FC6681D.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

0C3C224E6036448F9EA1638A7A699051.description: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey experiences and events.

B2EFF3E5A7D347FF9DC6BB507592FD1D.description:
Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting
to another.

7CA4B78F54244704ADFC8C1F6A6E6174.description:
When appropriate use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or
characters.

3C6157E522B94E41A7192EB94AE2423E.description: Organize ideas and event so that they unfold naturally.

4C37B6C822374FB78841AB504CEE3492.description: Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and introducing a narrator and/or characters.

7684418628E64167BDD39E38B187151B.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured
event sequences.
a. Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that
unfolds naturally and logically.
b. Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.
c. Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.
d. Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey experiences and events.
e. Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

F7AFD8C2DA034D7B841EAB7DA964A16B.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and summarizes the information presented.

D4831147C19B49DD8FC9DED333541560.description: Maintain a consistent style and voice throughout writing.

F8E598DFC14E4F5AADFCA05554A3E92F.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

F13AC34592BE4FE78C2BFE5174541C3B.description: Use transitional words, phrases, and clauses that connect ideas and create cohesion within writing.

7F49182F40114D1CBF7789CD5C966A55.description:
Include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to promote reading
understanding.

D81040C84D2A42F3AF8B972633917A86.description:
Develop the topic (add additional information related to the topic) with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations,
or other information and examples.

6A2FA92015164224BE00C43A58D792EF.description: Write an introduction that includes context/background information establishes a central idea or focus about a topic.

0B8ED524747B4485897BE14D0265FE46.description: Organize ideas, concepts, and information (e.g., using definition, classification, comparison/contrast, cause/effect).

67FBAAC2BF2A44C1AD93774A27F4CB24.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information
through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.
a. Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition,
classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when
useful to aiding comprehension.
b. Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.
c. Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.
d. Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.
e. Establish and maintain a formal style.
f. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanation presented.

9D2BB224777047E3A0239B3D95F6D4F9.description: Distinguish claims presented orally or in writing that are supported by reasons and claims that are not.

FB9E4FB711CB4E57B28C2AD15EC5679B.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows the argument presented.

169D89EDC21F4B82A2F582E2882E9B9C.description: Use words, phrases and clauses to link claims, and reasons.

AC6EB42D363642208800AC84BF1B71A1.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence from credible sources.

0BEEF484BAFA4157A66996529DBE9D5F.description: Create an organizational structure in which ideas are logically grouped to support the writer's claim.

3A39A13BB6994DD89F20C0F1DA74818D.description: Write an introduction that introduces the writer's claim within persuasive text.

66525050FB664962926FA1149B71D07F.description:
Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.
a. Introduce claim(s) and organize the reasons and evidence clearly.
b. Support claim(s) with clear reasons and relevant evidence, using credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.
c. Use words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationships among claim(s) and reasons.
d. Establish and maintain a formal style.
e. Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the argument presented.

1AF8AFB76876415BA0C0C241019CF19A.description: Use a variety of strategies to (e.g., use context, affixes and roots) derive meaning from a variety of print/non-print texts.

B77E7FD895FB483BAB39183FAA020DA0.description:
Read or be read to a variety of texts including historical novels, fantasy stories and novels, poetry, fiction, and nonfiction
novels.

739DC8F3A3034060BFAE5B065503E99F.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend informational texts and nonfiction in a text complexity range
determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 6.

FC078E46C35F4D8E8D7433B97D7EBA7D.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

91B2D4E752C74AABB9760CC8D5BBDE67.description:
Compare and contrast one author's presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written by and a biography on
the same person).

65EA69D56BEA45448A40EFCFA8E3D0F7.description: Compare and contrast one author's presentation of events with that of another author.

645B3643EAEF411192608A1AD4ED0529.description: Distinguish claims or arguments from those that are supported by evidence from those that are not.

BC83CB1DB8EF4002AC5A814D720948A1.description: Evaluate the claim or argument; determine if it is supported by evidence.

59C5555346D840F9B44AE96067E98216.description: Identify an argument or claim that the author makes.

DE385DCF97E745A586A40479DE3B2BEC.description:
Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims
that are not.

6836752CF3664380BA592677B5FA051A.description: Identify relevant details from several texts on the same topic (e.g., what are the important things that you learned?).

118A2F3ECD42441098630F0612BD8C93.description: Summarize information gained from a variety of sources including media or texts.

84F51BFAD99A45CEAB520A4F72402F0C.description: Identify what is learned from different media or formats compared to what is learned via written words or spoken words.

10E04A021657448E8D400CC57C73015F.description:
Integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a coherent
understanding of a topic or issue.

B1D65E1023344BB7916BD67202AA884A.description: Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed.

07B75298DB8B42A4A06A2515A61BF00A.description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

EB138B0A13AE45DF9FEED2610511577D.description:
Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas,
concepts, or information in two or more texts.

FB8C149FCE7A4974A42B4677B4245646.description:
Use signal words as a means of locating information (e.g., knowing that "because" or "as a result of" may help link a cause to
a result).

05E4B785296444D0B69B667D686F21A2.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of
the ideas.

2FD31BF753B04F6F8D8F095AD225DFD6.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text including figurative (i.e., metaphors, similes, and
idioms) and connotative meanings.

55C3077F1B024EB9B3F8034CBAB006BA.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

F4713F4A68B64075B9E19BD26A1AC41A.description: Determine how key individuals, events, or ideas are elaborated or expanded on in a text.

733F5A16E0A64DC2AC5801B4BE3F802F.description: Determine how key individuals, events, or ideas are illustrated in a text.

2B54AAAD8CA2413492CBC0AC832735E5.description: Determine how key individuals, events, or ideas are introduced in a text.

245EB3660FD24A34B451F2AB1A3EDA21.description: Identify key individuals, events, or ideas in a text.

DE0431BB046F438DA616772D9E936F79.description: Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and developed in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

DFBB20368F2B4FCCA750722F3B804AFA.description: Provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

04D57FD7006040E6BC60DDD0C9C3B91E.description:
Determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal
opinions or judgments.

4496B168382E4096815794D3110B3C80.description: Use textual evidence to support inferences.

2D8BEEF1E789452CA31B82A7DB7BB7D3.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

B6E5F47ABCD2456F92BD09A6E4AB0478.description: Use a variety of strategies to derive meaning from a variety of texts.

B1F179BD23B14EC1B8BF87B25BE3119F.description:
Read or be read to a variety of texts or adapted texts including historical novels, fantasy stories and novels, poetry, fiction,
and nonfiction novels.

5B54D452D4B44C9C9208C79969285E94.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, in a text
complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 6.

F14AADADD34A440182BE4553A653B73A.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

1295B6B8619044D29B91A2A2D334A947.description: Compare texts from different genres that have a similar theme or address the same topic.

BEDFDF2490F64C01BBAA92A96FFD578C.description:
Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their
approaches to similar themes and topics.

FCBA4935D37749589AEFB6320FCB2188.description: Compare the experience of reading a story or drama to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text.

38B3D37BC3CB412BBF75BB5A1C31DEC8.description:
Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text,
including contrasting what they "see" and "hear" when reading the text to what they perceive when they listen or watch.

3CC0C6E26A5140258BCB0786B6650258.description: Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

6A1DCC7B2DA541F5AD81B418D01449FE.description: Identify and describe how the narrative point of view influences the reader's interpretation.

F248C982659F4075AF0FF49E11DB194D.description: Determine the narrative point of view.

ED9B2A7A7A424EF18762735B27A44340.description: Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

26E19F3C04B34991BE7225DBFBE93B60.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the
development of the theme, setting, or plot.

AAC945D2616342B1AEA11316BEB52155.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the
theme, setting, or plot.

C313DC4196684E968A49E8377B2159F3.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text including figurative (i.e., metaphors, similes, and
idioms) and connotative meanings.

5B5F1AB4DA8B4C5FAA17F12EA8217A2F.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a
specific word choice on meaning and tone.

F0E4CD8F423244BAAE7B37FB0D22C9DB.description: Analyze a character's interactions throughout a story as they relate to conflict and resolution.

140882BCB63D48E4A2346FB8AF59B280.description: Describe how the plot unfolds in a story.

B7623B23606D47C890651448222CEE62.description:
Describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot
moves toward a resolution.

5B6C828389A7477583E91EE4D6AF19AD.description: Summarize a text from beginning to end in a few sentences without including personal opinions.

653A82BA3B2640EBBBC7B19405D5B224.description: Determine the theme(s) of a story, drama, or poem including how it is conveyed through particular details.

088B335A10A94E50A0801ED1DE9CD0C3.description: Select key details about a character and relate those details to a theme within the text.

32537CA4D46F43A8843174A4CCA90252.description:
Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from
personal opinions or judgments.

AF3310E618164BA7848BC5CEB6D499C0.description: Use the specific details from the text to support inferences and explanations about plot development.

666573B034B5485CAABD921B2FF733CD.description:
Use specific details from the text (words, interactions, thoughts, motivations) to support inferences or conclusions about
characters including how they change during the course of the story. Part b

F1107AB2F6314B70A3828DB14EFFE143.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly.

B47219F0B16141909D4FBB1FFA5C8F52.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.
